description: Davis frankly discussed the "thinness issue" that plagued her early acting career.

Kristin Davis just revealed how her Sex and the City co-star Sarah Jessica Parker was an integral part of her eating disorder recovery. On Monday's episode of her "Are You a Charlotte?" podcast, Davis opened up about the "thinness issue" that plagued her earlier in her career.

The actress shared how Parker helped her identify a diagnosis: “There were times when Sarah Jessica would be like, ‘You have body dysmorphia.’ And I’d be like, I don't think I do because the world is literally telling me daily that I am pear shaped,” Davis shared. “Like so much to the point where, like, you can't think straight.”

“But then you also have disordered eating. You're starving yourself,” she continued. “I remember fainting in a parking lot one time because I was on some crazy diet…all the craziness.”

Davis said that receiving back-handed compliments from fans would often stoke her insecurities.

“There was a good number of years when people would see me on the street and they would say, ‘Oh, but you're not fat.’ And I know they didn't mean anything bad," Davis explained. "They mean it as a compliment, right? But it's because I'm standing next to Sarah Jessica. Or, ‘You're prettier in person.’ And I'm just like, 'Well, okay.'”

“There's like a weird cynicism about our industry and about us that then permeates the thinking,” she added.

Davis has previously spoken about how working in Hollywood contributed to her body dysmorphia. In a People interview from earlier this year, the And Just Like That star said she was told not to "gain any weight" while working on Melrose Place in the 1990s.

"It was normal for a long time. You could look at it either way," she said. "But I mean, there was a lot of stress. If you had hips, it was a situation."
